title: Improving UI performance when rendering large product lists
context: While building the product listing page for my e-commerce application.
problem: Rendering a large number of products caused noticeable UI lag and slow interactions.
decision: I decided to optimize rendering on the client side before introducing backend pagination to avoid premature complexity.
solution: I reduced unnecessary re-renders by memoizing components and rendering only the required items.
impact: UI interactions became smooth and page load time improved significantly.

title: Simplifying complex form state management
context: During development of authentication and checkout forms.
problem: Managing multiple input states individually made the code hard to maintain and error-prone.
decision: I chose a centralized state approach to make form logic predictable and scalable.
solution: I used a single state object and updated fields dynamically based on input name.
impact: Form logic became cleaner, easier to debug, and faster to extend.

title: Handling API errors consistently across the application
context: While developing REST APIs for multiple frontend consumers.
problem: Inconsistent error responses made frontend error handling unreliable.
decision: I implemented a centralized error response pattern to standardize API behavior.
solution: All API responses follow a common structure for success and failure cases.
impact: Frontend error handling became predictable and debugging time was reduced.

title: Resolving CORS issues while fetching news data from MongoDB
context: While building the Web News project, I stored news articles in MongoDB and fetched them through the backend controller.
problem: Fetching data from the backend caused CORS errors on the frontend, preventing the UI from receiving the news content.
decision: I decided to use CORS middleware in the backend to allow requests from the frontend domain safely.
solution: Configured CORS in the backend Express app to whitelist the frontend origin and allowed necessary HTTP methods.
impact: The frontend successfully received the news data without errors, ensuring smooth data flow and improved user experience.

title: Overriding default browser/OS font with custom font
context: While designing the portfolio and web app pages with a custom font.
problem: Even after applying the custom font (Nohaazar), the browser/OS default font was displayed.
decision: I used proper font-face declaration and applied the font globally using CSS variables to ensure consistent rendering.
solution: Added @font-face in CSS and set the font in body and root elements.
codeSnippet: @font-face { font-family: 'Nohaazar'; src: url('./fonts/Nohaazar.woff2'); } body { font-family: 'Nohaazar', sans-serif; }
impact: All pages now consistently render the custom font across browsers and OS.

title: Allowing backend server to listen on all network interfaces
context: When deploying backend to live server, app.listen caused errors due to default network restriction.
problem: Backend server was only listening on localhost, causing live frontend requests to fail.
decision: Configured the server to listen on all network interfaces to allow access from any IP.
solution: Used app.listen(4000, '0.0.0.0') in Express backend.
impact: Frontend can now access backend from any network without errors.

title: Fixing mobile responsiveness for navbar
context: During responsive design of portfolio and project pages.
problem: Navbar items overlapped on small screens and were not clickable.
decision: Used CSS flexbox with media queries to adapt the layout based on screen width.
solution: Added @media rules and adjusted flex-wrap and padding.
impact: Navbar now works flawlessly on all devices, improving UX.

title: Optimizing image loading for better performance
context: While adding project screenshots and blog images in portfolio.
problem: Large images slowed page load and affected user experience.
decision: Implemented lazy loading for images to render only when visible in viewport.
impact: Page load speed improved and visual content remained intact.

title: Implementing dark mode toggle
context: Portfolio website design with user preference for light/dark mode.
problem: User theme preference was not persistent across pages.
decision: Used React state and localStorage to save theme selection.
solution: const [theme, setTheme] = useState(localStorage.getItem('theme') || 'light');
impact: User-selected theme persists across pages, enhancing UX.

title: Fixing Image Distortion and 'Cutting' in Responsive Layouts
description: How to prevent user profile images from losing their focus (hair/face) when changing container heights.
context: While adjusting the profile image on the Contact page for better alignment.
problem: Reducing the image height caused the top part (hair) to disappear or the image to stretch.
decision: I used object-fit along with specific object-positioning to keep the focus on the subject.
solution: Applied 'object-cover' and 'object-top' classes to ensure the head remains visible even at lower heights.
impact: The profile picture now looks professional and consistent across all screen sizes.

title: Solving Scroll-Lock and Overflow in Fixed Modals
description: Fixing the issue where fixed position modals become unscrollable on smaller mobile screens.
context: Developing the 'Services' modal for mobile users.
problem: The modal was 'stuck' (fixed) and wouldn't scroll, making content at the bottom inaccessible on small phones.
decision: I implemented a nested scroll strategy using max-height and overflow-y-auto.
solution: Added 'max-h-[90vh]' to the modal box and 'overflow-y-auto' to both parent and child containers.
impact: Users can now smoothly scroll through services even on the smallest mobile devices.

title: Exposing Localhost to Mobile Devices for Real-Time Testing
description: How to test your Vite + React application on a physical mobile device using a local network.
context: Testing the responsiveness of the portfolio on a real smartphone.
problem: The local network link (IP address) was not opening on the mobile browser despite being on the same Wi-Fi.
decision: I diagnosed it as a Firewall/Network visibility issue and exposed the Vite host.
solution: Used 'npm run dev -- --host' and adjusted Windows Firewall settings to allow Node.js traffic.
impact: Enabled instant mobile testing, which helped catch several UI bugs before deployment.

title: Syncing Dark Mode with LocalStorage and System Preferences
description: Implementing a theme toggle that remembers user choice and prevents the 'white flash' on reload.
context: Adding a dark theme option to the entire portfolio.
problem: The theme would reset to light mode every time the user refreshed the page.
decision: I utilized LocalStorage to persist the state and a useEffect hook to apply the class globally.
solution: Saved the theme string in LocalStorage and checked it on the initial component mount.
impact: Provided a seamless user experience that respects user preference across sessions.

title: Securing JWT Tokens in MERN Stack
description: How to handle authentication tokens safely to prevent XSS and CSRF attacks.
context: During the Auth & Checkout module development.
problem: Storing JWT in LocalStorage made the application vulnerable to script-based attacks.
decision: I switched to HTTP-Only cookies for token storage.
solution: Implemented cookie-parser in Express and set 'httpOnly: true' in the response.
codeSnippet: res.cookie('token', token, { httpOnly: true, secure: true });
impact: Application security improved by preventing client-side script access to sensitive tokens.

title: Handling Strict Schema Validation in MongoDB
description: Ensuring data integrity by implementing Mongoose schemas for complex product data.
context: Building the E-commerce product database.
problem: Random data formats in the products collection were causing frontend crashes.
decision: I implemented strict Mongoose models with required fields and types.
solution: Defined a ProductSchema with validation rules for price, category, and stock.
codeSnippet: new mongoose.Schema({ price: { type: Number, required: true } });
impact: Database consistency reached 100%, and frontend rendering errors were eliminated.

title: Extracting Reusable Logic with React Custom Hooks
description: How I reduced code duplication by creating a custom hook for API fetching.
context: While fetching data for News, Products, and User Profile.
problem: The same useEffect and state logic was repeated in 5 different components.
decision: I decided to build a 'useFetch' custom hook.
solution: Encapsulated loading, error, and data states into a single reusable function.
impact: Reduced the codebase size by 20% and made maintenance much easier.

title: Implementing Real-Time Search and Filtering
description: Building a high-performance search bar that filters data as the user types.
context: The product search feature in the E-commerce app.
problem: Filtering 500+ items on every keystroke was making the input feel 'heavy'.
decision: I used the '.filter()' method with lowercase normalization.
solution: Filtered the data based on multiple criteria like name, category, and price range.
impact: Users can now find products instantly without any lag.

title: Optimizing Large Assets for Web Performance
description: Why I switched from local image storage to CDN-based asset management.
context: Managing high-resolution product images.
problem: Page load time was over 5 seconds due to large image files.
decision: I moved all assets to Cloudinary and used optimized URLs.
solution: Implemented auto-format and auto-quality parameters in image links.
impact: Reduced initial load time from 5s to under 1.5s.

title: Mastering Complex Form Validation with Regex
description: Ensuring user data quality through robust client-side validation.
context: User registration and checkout forms.
problem: Users were submitting invalid emails and weak passwords.
decision: I implemented Regular Expression (Regex) checks on all inputs.
solution: Added real-time feedback to show error messages before form submission.
impact: Invalid form submissions decreased by 80%.

title: Server-Side Pagination for Large Datasets
description: Handling massive amounts of data without crashing the browser.
context: The News Platform backend.
problem: Sending 1000+ news articles in one API call was killing performance.
decision: I implemented limit and skip logic in MongoDB queries.
solution: Created a dynamic API endpoint that accepts page numbers and limits.
impact: API response size reduced by 90%, making the app blazing fast.

title: Building a Robust Responsive Grid for All Devices
description: Solving layout breaks in multi-column designs using Tailwind Grid.
context: Portfolio project gallery and Blog list.
problem: Cards were overlapping or becoming too narrow on tablets (iPad size).
decision: I implemented a mobile-first grid strategy with break-points.
solution: Used 'grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3' for perfect adaptation.
impact: Layout remains perfect from a small iPhone to a 4K Monitor.

title: Understanding and Resolving CORS in Production
description: How to allow cross-origin requests safely without leaving security gaps.
context: Deploying the Backend and Frontend to different domains.
problem: Frontend could not fetch data due to 'No Access-Control-Allow-Origin' error.
decision: I configured the CORS package with specific origin whitelisting.
solution: Set the origin to my frontend URL instead of using '*' for security.
impact: Secure communication established between frontend and backend.

title: Preserving Cart State During User Navigation
description: Preventing users from losing their cart items on page refresh.
context: E-commerce checkout process.
problem: Refreshing the page cleared the React State, causing the cart to become empty.
decision: I integrated Redux-Persist or LocalStorage logic.
solution: Stored the cart array in LocalStorage every time it was updated.
impact: Improved user conversion rates as they didn't have to re-add items.
